EV isolated method:
Peripheral blood mononuclear cells and SFMCs were stimulated with plate-bound anti-CD3, 1 µg/ml (clone: F7.2.38, Dako) and anti-CD28, 1 µg/ml (clone: CD28.2, BD) for 48 h in EV-free media (RPMI supplemented with: 1% penicillin/streptamycin, 1% glutamine). Non-stimulated cells were also cultured for 48 h. Cells and dead cells were excluded by two centrifugations at 335 g for 10 min. Cell debris were excluded by UC at 30,000 g for 35 min. EVs were isolated by UC at 100,000 g for 90 min [28]. We chose this protocol to obtain a high number of vesicles.
[28] Momen-Heravi F, Balaj L, Alian S, Mantel P-Y, Halleck AE, Trachtenberg AJ, et al. Current methods for the isolation of extracellular vesicles. Biol Chem (2013) 394:1–10.
